item.title: Chart: Drug use was falling, but that seems to be changing
item.description:
Self-reported drug use has fallen for most of the past 20 years, but in the past six years the use of cannabis, cocaine and ecstasy has increased, particularly among people aged 16–24. However, drug use is still lower now than it was at the turn of the millenium.

Data source: Crime Survey for England and Wales, 2018

item.title: Chart: Fewer people are victims of common crimes than 30 years' ago
item.description:
Across many common crime types, fewer people are victims now than 30 years’ ago. For example, for every 100 people who were a victim of vehicle-related theft at least once in 1987, only 25 people were a victim at least once in 2017.
